intro: Lannea obcordata, commonly known as the African wild pear, is a deciduous tree native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, lobed leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by edible, pear-shaped fruits that are yellow when ripe. Lannea obcordata is adapted to dry climates and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. It plays an important ecological role and is also valued for its timber and fruit in local communities.
